payload.name: roofline-model
payload.title: Roofline model: performance is min(compute peak, bandwidth peak × arithmetic intensity)
payload.formal:
[
P = \min(P_{\text{peak}}, ; BW_{\text{peak}} \cdot AI)
]
where (AI = \frac{\text{FLOPs}}{\text{bytes moved}}). This is the cleanest “why is my code slow?” litmus test.
payload.apm2_mapping: APM2’s *dominant* workload is often “move bytes and validate them” (ledger/event replay, CAS retrieval, schema validation, policy eval), which is usually **bandwidth/latency bound**, not FLOP bound. That means performance wins come from: (a) fewer bytes (principle 5), (b) fewer round‑trips (13), (c) deterministic compression (66), and (d) locality (20–22). Treat “bytes moved per verified progress” as a first‑class metric in the observability plane.
